reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Most entrepreneurs put in tremendous amounts of time and effort in creating and launching new products and services and then make the mistake of overpricing them. They have created something they care deeply about, it's theirs, and this powerful sense of ownership distorts their perception of value which causes them to overprice their products. While many of them are quick to realize that their initial prices are too high, not all these people are happy or willing to drop their prices to make their products more attractive. And this can be a very costly mistake that may lead to the failure of their new business. When you launch a new product or service, your priority should be to get sufficient market adoption as soon as possible and you should be ready to sacrifice your initial prices and profits to achieve this aim. Once you have strong sales volumes, you can increase your prices to maximize your profits.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 목적으로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: to advise on a pricing strategy for new products
to criticize entrepreneurs for being too greedy
to explain the psychological power of ownership
to emphasize the importance of product quality
to compare different types of business failures

answer.explanation: 이 글은 기업가들이 신제품 가격을 너무 높게 책정하는 실수를 저지르는 경향이 있다고 지적한 뒤, 성공적인 사업을 위해 따라야 할 가격 책정 전략을 제시합니다. 특히, 초기에는 이익을 희생하더라도 시장 점유율(market adoption)을 확보하는 것을 우선시하고, 그 이후에 가격을 올려 이익을 극대화하라고 조언하고 있습니다. 따라서 이 글의 주된 목적은 '신제품에 대한 가격 책정 전략을 조언하기 위함'입니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Most entrepreneurs put in tremendous amounts of time and effort in creating and launching new products and services and then make the mistake of overpricing them. They have created something they care deeply about, it's theirs, and this powerful sense of ownership distorts their perception of value which causes them to overprice their products. While many of them are quick to realize that their initial prices are too high, not all these people are happy or willing to drop their prices to make their products more attractive. And this can be a very costly mistake that may lead to the failure of their new business. When you launch a new product or service, your priority should be to get sufficient market adoption as soon as possible and you should be ready to sacrifice your initial prices and profits to achieve this aim. Once you have strong sales volumes, you can increase your prices to maximize your profits.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 제목으로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: Price for Adoption, Not Early Profit
The True Value of a New Product

answer.explanation: 이 글의 핵심 주장은 신제품 출시 초기에는 높은 '이익(profit)'을 추구하기보다는, 낮은 가격으로 충분한 '시장 점유(market adoption)'를 확보하는 것을 우선해야 한다는 것입니다. 따라서 '초기 이익이 아닌, 시장 점유를 위해 가격을 책정하라'는 제목이 글의 중심 내용을 가장 명확하게 요약합니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Most entrepreneurs put in tremendous amounts of time and effort in creating and launching new products and services and then make the mistake of overpricing them. They have created something they care deeply about, it's theirs, and this powerful sense of ownership distorts their perception of value which causes them to overprice their products. While many of them are quick to realize that their initial prices are too high, not all these people are happy or willing to drop their prices to make their products more attractive. And this can be a very costly mistake that may lead to the failure of their new business. When you launch a new product or service, your priority should be to get sufficient market adoption as soon as possible and you should be ready to sacrifice your initial prices and profits to achieve this aim. Once you have strong sales volumes, you can increase your prices to maximize your profits.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 요지로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: For new products, prioritizing market adoption through lower initial prices is crucial for long-term business success.
Entrepreneurs often fail because they do not have a strong enough sense of ownership over their products.
The initial price of a new product should reflect the tremendous amount of time and effort invested.
Maximizing profits from the very beginning is the most important goal for any new business venture.
Once a product's price has been set, it should never be changed to avoid confusing the customers.

answer.explanation: 이 글은 신제품 출시 시 기업가들이 저지르는 가격 책정 실수와 그 원인을 분석한 후, 올바른 전략을 제시합니다. 핵심은 '우선순위(priority)'를 즉각적인 이익이 아닌 '시장 점유(market adoption)'에 두어야 하며, 이를 위해 초기 가격과 이익을 '희생(sacrifice)'할 준비가 되어 있어야 한다는 것입니다. 이는 장기적인 사업 성공을 위한 핵심 전략입니다. 따라서 '신제품의 경우, 낮은 초기 가격을 통한 시장 점유 우선시가 장기적인 사업 성공에 매우 중요하다'가 글의 요지입니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: They have created something they care deeply about, it's theirs, and this powerful sense of ownership distorts their perception of value which causes them to overprice their products. While many of them are quick to realize that their initial prices are too high, not all these people are happy or willing to drop their prices to make their products more attractive. ( ① ) When you launch a new product or service, your priority should be to get sufficient market adoption as soon as possible and you should be ready to sacrifice your initial prices and profits to achieve this aim. ( ② ) Once you have strong sales volumes, you can increase your prices to maximize your profits. ( ③ )
reading_comprehension_problems.question:
글의 흐름으로 보아, 주어진 문장이 들어가기에 가장 적절한 곳은?

**And this can be a very costly mistake that may lead to the failure of their new business.**

answer.explanation: 주어진 문장은 '그리고 이것은 신규 사업의 실패로 이어질 수 있는 매우 대가가 큰 실수가 될 수 있다'는 내용입니다. 여기서 '이것(this)'은 바로 앞 문장에서 언급된 '가격을 낮추기를 꺼리는 태도'를 가리킵니다. 이 문장은 그러한 태도의 심각한 결과를 경고하며, 이어지는 문장에서 필자가 제안하는 올바른 해결책('우선순위는 시장 점유여야 한다')으로 자연스럽게 넘어가는 다리 역할을 합니다. 따라서 주어진 문장은 문제 상황 설명과 해결책 제시 사이인 ①에 들어가는 것이 가장 적절합니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Most entrepreneurs put in tremendous amounts of time and effort in creating and launching new products and services and then make the mistake of overpricing them.

question_blocks.A: While many of them are quick to realize that their initial prices are too high, not all these people are happy or willing to drop their prices to make their products more attractive. And this can be a very costly mistake that may lead to the failure of their new business.
question_blocks.B: They have created something they care deeply about, it's theirs, and this powerful sense of ownership distorts their perception of value which causes them to overprice their products.
question_blocks.C: When you launch a new product or service, your priority should be to get sufficient market adoption as soon as possible and you should be ready to sacrifice your initial prices and profits to achieve this aim. Once you have strong sales volumes, you can increase your prices to maximize your profits.

reading_comprehension_problems.question: 주어진 글 다음에 이어질 글의 순서로 가장 적절한 것은?

answer.explanation: 주어진 글은 기업가들이 신제품 가격을 너무 높게 책정하는 실수를 저지른다고 말하며 문제를 제기합니다. (B)는 그 실수의 원인이 '강력한 소유 의식(powerful sense of ownership)' 때문이라고 설명합니다. (A)는 가격이 높다는 것을 깨닫고도 낮추기를 꺼리는 추가적인 문제와 그 결과(사업 실패)를 설명합니다. (C)는 이러한 문제들에 대한 필자의 해결책, 즉 시장 점유를 우선시하는 올바른 가격 전략을 제시합니다. 따라서 '문제 제기 -> 원인 분석(B) -> 심화된 문제(A) -> 해결책 제시(C)'의 흐름이 가장 논리적입니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Most entrepreneurs put in tremendous amounts of time and effort in creating and launching new products and services and then make the mistake of overpricing them. They have created something they care deeply about, it's theirs, and this powerful sense of ownership distorts their perception of value which causes them to overprice their products. While many of them are quick to realize that their initial prices are too high, not all these people are happy or willing to drop their prices to make their products more attractive. And this can be a very costly mistake that may lead to the failure of their new business. When you launch a new product or service, your priority should be to __________________________ as soon as possible and you should be ready to sacrifice your initial prices and profits to achieve this aim. Once you have strong sales volumes, you can increase your prices to maximize your profits.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 빈칸에 들어갈 말로 가장 적절한 것은?

answer.explanation: 빈칸이 포함된 문장은 신제품 출시 시 무엇을 '우선순위(priority)'로 두어야 하는지에 대해 말하고 있습니다. 필자는 초기 가격과 이익을 '희생(sacrifice)'해서라도 이 목표를 달성해야 한다고 조언합니다. 이는 즉각적인 이익 극대화가 아니라, 더 많은 고객이 제품을 사용하게 만드는 것, 즉 '충분한 시장 점유를 확보하는 것(get sufficient market adoption)'이 최우선 목표임을 의미합니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Most entrepreneurs put in ① `tremendous` amounts of time and effort... and then make the mistake of overpricing them. They have created something they care deeply about ... and this powerful sense of ownership ② `improves` their perception of value which causes them to overprice their products. While many of them are quick to realize that their initial prices are too high, not all these people are happy or willing to drop their prices to make their products more ③ `attractive`. And this can be a very costly mistake that may lead to the ④ `failure` of their new business. When you launch a new product or service, your ⑤ `priority` should be to get sufficient market adoption as soon as possible...
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 밑줄 친 부분 중, 문맥상 낱말의 쓰임이 적절하지 않은 것은?

answer.explanation: 이 글은 강한 소유 의식이 기업가들로 하여금 자신의 제품 가치를 과대평가하게 만들어 가격을 너무 높게 책정하는 실수를 유발한다고 설명합니다. 따라서 소유 의식은 가치에 대한 인식을 '왜곡한다(distorts)'고 해야 문맥이 맞습니다. '향상시킨다(improves)'는 글의 논리와 정반대되는 의미입니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Most entrepreneurs put in tremendous amounts of time and effort in creating and (A) `launching` new products ... and this powerful sense of ownership (B) `distorts` their perception of value... your priority should be to get (C) `sufficient` market adoption as soon as possible and you should be ready to (D) `sacrifice` your initial prices and profits to achieve this aim. Once you have strong sales volumes, you can increase your prices to (E) `maximize` your profits.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 밑줄 친 (A)~(E)에 대한 영영 풀이가 적절하지 않은 것은?

options.text: (A) launching: introducing something new, such as a product
(B) distorts: to change something from its usual, original, or natural condition
(C) sufficient: enough for a particular purpose; adequate
(D) sacrifice: to give up something that is valuable to you for the sake of other considerations
(E) maximize: to reduce something to the smallest possible amount or degree

answer.explanation: 본문에서 (E) `maximize`는 '극대화하다'라는 의미로, 판매량이 확보된 후에 이익을 최대한으로 늘릴 수 있다는 뜻으로 사용되었습니다. 하지만 보기 ⑤의 영영 풀이는 '무언가를 가능한 가장 작은 양이나 정도로 줄이다'로, 이는 '최소화하다(minimize)'의 의미입니다. 따라서 'maximize'의 의미와 정반대이므로 적절하지 않은 풀이입니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Most entrepreneurs ... make the mistake of (A) [overpricing / underpricing] them. They have created something they care deeply about, it's theirs, and this powerful sense of ownership (B) [distorts / clarifies] their perception of value... When you launch a new product or service, your (C) [priority / option] should be to get sufficient market adoption as soon as possible...
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 각 네모 안에서 문맥에 맞는 낱말로 가장 적절한 것은?

answer.explanation: (A) 글의 서두에서 기업가들이 저지르는 실수로 신제품의 가격을 너무 높게 책정하는 것, 즉 '과대 책정(overpricing)'을 언급합니다. (B) 이러한 실수의 원인으로 소유 의식이 가치에 대한 인식을 '왜곡하기(distorts)' 때문이라고 설명합니다. (C) 필자는 신제품 출시 시의 '우선순위(priority)'는 시장 점유 확보가 되어야 한다고 조언합니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: They have created something they care deeply about, it's theirs, and this powerful sense of ownership distorts their perception of value which causes them to overprice their products. ① While many of them are quick to realize that their initial prices are too high, not all these people are happy or willing to drop their prices. ② An entrepreneur is defined as an individual who creates a new business, bearing most of the risks and enjoying most of the rewards. ③ And this can be a very costly mistake that may lead to the failure of their new business. ④ When you launch a new product or service, your priority should be to get sufficient market adoption.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글에서 전체 흐름과 관계 없는 문장은?

answer.explanation: 이 글은 기업가(entrepreneur)가 신제품 가격 책정 시 저지르는 심리적 오류와 올바른 전략에 대해 논하고 있습니다. ①, ③, ④번 문장은 모두 이러한 가격 책정의 문제점과 해결책이라는 중심 주제와 긴밀하게 연결됩니다. 하지만 ②번 문장 '기업가는 대부분의 위험을 감수하고 대부분의 보상을 누리며 새로운 사업을 만드는 개인으로 정의된다'는 '기업가'에 대한 사전적 정의일 뿐, 가격 책정 전략이라는 글의 구체적인 논점에서 벗어나므로 전체 흐름과 관계가 없습니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Most entrepreneurs put in tremendous amounts of time and effort in ① [creating / to create] and launching new products and services and then make the mistake of overpricing them. They have created something they care deeply about, it's theirs, and this powerful sense of ownership distorts their perception of value which ② [causes / cause] them to overprice their products. While many of them are quick to realize that their initial prices are too high, not all these people are happy or willing ③ [to drop / dropping] their prices to make their products more attractive.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 각 네모 안에서 어법에 맞는 표현으로 가장 적절한 것을 각각 고르시오.

answer.explanation: 전치사 'in'의 목적어로는 동명사가 와야 합니다. 'creating'은 and 뒤의 'launching'과 병렬 구조를 이루고 있습니다.
관계대명사 'which'의 선행사는 앞 문장 전체 혹은 'this powerful sense of ownership'으로, 단수 취급합니다. 따라서 주격 관계대명사절의 동사는 3인칭 단수형인 'causes'가 와야 합니다.
형용사 'willing'은 뒤에 to부정사를 목적어로 취하여 'be willing to do' (~하기를 기꺼이 하다)의 형태로 사용됩니다. 따라서 'to drop'이 어법에 맞습니다.
